meanings.definition: A type of traditional Japanese footwear, typically made of straw or rubber.
meanings.sent1: I bought a new pair of zori for the summer festival.
meanings.sent2: In Japan, many people wear zori with their yukata.
meanings.sent3: The zori were so comfortable that I felt like I was walking on clouds.
meanings.sent4: Her zori whispered softly against the tatami mats as she walked.
meanings.sent5: The vibrant red zori stood out against the traditional kimono.

meanings.definition: To wear zori, a type of traditional Japanese footwear.
meanings.sent1: I zori every time I visit the hot springs.
meanings.sent2: She zoried gracefully across the garden path.
meanings.sent3: He zoried his way through the crowded marketplace, attracting curious glances.
meanings.sent4: The dancer zoried as if floating on air, captivating the audience.
meanings.sent5: They zori with such elegance and poise, it was mesmerizing to watch.

meanings.definition: The plural form of zori, a type of traditional Japanese footwear.
meanings.sent1: I own several pairs of zori for different occasions.
meanings.sent2: The family lined up their zori neatly by the door.
meanings.sent3: The zori in the store display seemed to gossip amongst themselves.
meanings.sent4: The sound of many zori clacking echoed through the temple grounds.
meanings.sent5: The colorful zori added a festive touch to the traditional attire.
